title: About Me
text: Hello! I’m passionate about using GIS and programming to solve real-world problems in public and environmental health. I believe in the power of data and technology to create meaningful change.

title: About Me
text:
My Background
I have a strong foundation in geospatial analysis, data visualization, and programming. My work focuses on applying these skills to address challenges in public health, environmental sustainability, and urban planning.

Education: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from SUNY Binghamton.
Skills: GIS (ArcGIS, QGIS), Python, R, JavaScript, Data Visualization, Spatial Analysis.
Interests: Public health, environmental sustainability, open data, and community-driven solutions.

title: About Me
text:
My Work
I’ve worked on a variety of projects, including: - Mapping disease outbreaks to identify high-risk areas. - Developing interactive dashboards for visualizing environmental data. - Automating data workflows to improve efficiency and accuracy.

title: About Me
text:
Let’s Connect
I’m always excited to collaborate on new projects or discuss ideas. Feel free to reach out!

LinkedIn
GitHub

title: Maps
text:
This page showcases interactive maps and dashboards that communicate geospatial data effectively. Below is an example of a dashboard created on ArcGIS Online to visualize positive COVID-19 cases per MODZCTA (Modified Zip Code Tabulation Areas) in New York City.




 






Hotspots: Areas with the highest concentration of positive cases.
Trends Over Time: Use the time slider to see how cases evolved during the pandemic.
Demographics: Explore how different neighborhoods were affected.








Description: A map showing vaccination rates by neighborhood.
Tools Used: ArcGIS Online, NYC Health Data.
View Project





Description: A map visualizing subway and bus accessibility across NYC.
Tools Used: QGIS, OpenStreetMap.
View Project





Description: A map showing temperature variations across NYC.
Tools Used: ArcGIS Pro, Landsat Satellite Data.
View Project







ArcGIS Online: For creating interactive dashboards.
QGIS: For advanced geospatial analysis.
R/Python: For data processing and visualization.
Leaflet.js: For custom web maps.





This page is part of my portfolio for GTECH 78534: WebGIS. It demonstrates my ability to create user-interactive geospatial visualizations that communicate complex data effectively.
For more information, feel free to contact me.

h2 { color: #2c3e50; border-bottom: 2px solid #2c3e50; padding-bottom: 10px; }
a { color: #007bff; text-decoration: none; }
a:hover { text-decoration: underline; }
